location: A cavern. In the middle, a boiling cauldron.

lines.text: Thunder. Enter the three Witches

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Thrice the brinded cat hath mew'd.

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: Thrice and once the hedge-pig whined.

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: Harpier cries 'Tis time, 'tis time.

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Round about the cauldron go; In the poison'd entrails throw. Toad, that under cold stone Days and nights has thirty-one Swelter'd venom sleeping got, Boil thou first i' the charmed pot.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Double, double toil and trouble; Fire burn, and cauldron bubble.

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: Fillet of a fenny snake, In the cauldron boil and bake; Eye of newt and toe of frog, Wool of bat and tongue of dog, Adder's fork and blind-worm's sting, Lizard's leg and owlet's wing, For a charm of powerful trouble, Like a hell-broth boil and bubble.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Double, double toil and trouble; Fire burn and cauldron bubble.

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: Scale of dragon, tooth of wolf, Witches' mummy, maw and gulf Of the ravin'd salt-sea shark, Root of hemlock digg'd i' the dark, Liver of blaspheming Jew, Gall of goat, and slips of yew Silver'd in the moon's eclipse, Nose of Turk and Tartar's lips, Finger of birth-strangled babe Ditch-deliver'd by a drab, Make the gruel thick and slab: Add thereto a tiger's chaudron, For the ingredients of our cauldron.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Double, double toil and trouble; Fire burn and cauldron bubble.

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: Cool it with a baboon's blood, Then the charm is firm and good.
Enter HECATE to the other three Witches

lines.speaker: hecate
lines.text: O well done! I commend your pains; And every one shall share i' the gains; And now about the cauldron sing, Live elves and fairies in a ring, Enchanting all that you put in. Music and a song: 'Black spirits,'  and c
HECATE retires

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes. Open, locks, Whoever knocks!
Enter MACBETH

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: How now, you secret, black, and midnight hags! What is't you do?

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: A deed without a name.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: I conjure you, by that which you profess, Howe'er you come to know it, answer me: Though you untie the winds and let them fight Against the churches; though the yesty waves Confound and swallow navigation up; Though bladed corn be lodged and trees blown down; Though castles topple on their warders' heads; Though palaces and pyramids do slope Their heads to their foundations; though the treasure Of nature's germens tumble all together, Even till destruction sicken; answer me To what I ask you.

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Speak.

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: Demand.

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: We'll answer.

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Say, if thou'dst rather hear it from our mouths, Or from our masters?

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Call 'em; let me see 'em.

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Pour in sow's blood, that hath eaten Her nine farrow; grease that's sweaten From the murderer's gibbet throw Into the flame.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Come, high or low; Thyself and office deftly show! Thunder. First Apparition: an armed Head

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Tell me, thou unknown power,--

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: He knows thy thought: Hear his speech, but say thou nought.

lines.speaker: first apparition
lines.text: Macbeth! Macbeth! Macbeth! beware Macduff; Beware the thane of Fife. Dismiss me. Enough.
Descends

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Whate'er thou art, for thy good caution, thanks; Thou hast harp'd my fear aright: but one word more,--

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: He will not be commanded: here's another, More potent than the first. Thunder. Second Apparition: A bloody Child

lines.speaker: second apparition
lines.text: Macbeth! Macbeth! Macbeth!

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Had I three ears, I'ld hear thee.

lines.speaker: second apparition
lines.text: Be bloody, bold, and resolute; laugh to scorn The power of man, for none of woman born Shall harm Macbeth.
Descends

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Then live, Macduff: what need I fear of thee? But yet I'll make assurance double sure, And take a bond of fate: thou shalt not live; That I may tell pale-hearted fear it lies, And sleep in spite of thunder. Thunder. Third Apparition: a Child crowned, with a tree in his hand What is this That rises like the issue of a king, And wears upon his baby-brow the round And top of sovereignty?

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Listen, but speak not to't.

lines.speaker: third apparition
lines.text: Be lion-mettled, proud; and take no care Who chafes, who frets, or where conspirers are: Macbeth shall never vanquish'd be until Great Birnam wood to high Dunsinane hill Shall come against him.
Descends

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: That will never be Who can impress the forest, bid the tree Unfix his earth-bound root? Sweet bodements! good! Rebellion's head, rise never till the wood Of Birnam rise, and our high-placed Macbeth Shall live the lease of nature, pay his breath To time and mortal custom. Yet my heart Throbs to know one thing: tell me, if your art Can tell so much: shall Banquo's issue ever Reign in this kingdom?

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Seek to know no more.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: I will be satisfied: deny me this, And an eternal curse fall on you! Let me know. Why sinks that cauldron? and what noise is this?
Hautboys

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Show!

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: Show!

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: Show!

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Show his eyes, and grieve his heart; Come like shadows, so depart! A show of Eight Kings, the last with a glass in his hand; GHOST OF BANQUO following

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Thou art too like the spirit of Banquo: down! Thy crown does sear mine eye-balls. And thy hair, Thou other gold-bound brow, is like the first. A third is like the former. Filthy hags! Why do you show me this? A fourth! Start, eyes! What, will the line stretch out to the crack of doom? Another yet! A seventh! I'll see no more: And yet the eighth appears, who bears a glass Which shows me many more; and some I see That two-fold balls and treble scepters carry: Horrible sight! Now, I see, 'tis true; For the blood-bolter'd Banquo smiles upon me, And points at them for his. What, is this so?
Apparitions vanish

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Ay, sir, all this is so: but why Stands Macbeth thus amazedly? Come, sisters, cheer we up his sprites, And show the best of our delights: I'll charm the air to give a sound, While you perform your antic round: That this great king may kindly say, Our duties did his welcome pay.
Music. The witches dance and then vanish, with HECATE

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Where are they? Gone? Let this pernicious hour Stand aye accursed in the calendar! Come in, without there!
Enter LENNOX

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: What's your grace's will?

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Saw you the weird sisters?

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: No, my lord.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Came they not by you?

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: No, indeed, my lord.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Infected be the air whereon they ride; And damn'd all those that trust them! I did hear The galloping of horse: who was't came by?

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: 'Tis two or three, my lord, that bring you word Macduff is fled to England.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Fled to England!

lines.speaker: lennox
lines.text: Ay, my good lord.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Time, thou anticipatest my dread exploits: The flighty purpose never is o'ertook Unless the deed go with it; from this moment The very firstlings of my heart shall be The firstlings of my hand. And even now, To crown my thoughts with acts, be it thought and done: The castle of Macduff I will surprise; Seize upon Fife; give to the edge o' the sword His wife, his babes, and all unfortunate souls That trace him in his line. No boasting like a fool; This deed I'll do before this purpose cool. But no more sights!--Where are these gentlemen? Come, bring me where they are.
Exeunt
